revised_title: Exploring Linear Core Vortices in Excitable Media
tldr: The authors demonstrate the existence of vortices with linear cores in excitable media using partial differential equations and an optical mapping approach. They investigate the FitzHugh-Nagumo model of excitable media and discover that by modifying the equations, they can obtain rotating vortices with linear cores. This research provides evidence for the existence of linear and elliptical cores in cardiac muscle.
